body.p: Which of the following are vital functions of human life?

input.choice: exchange with the environment and structure, support and movement
the integumentary system and the skeletal system

feedback.p: Correct. These are two of the body's vital functions. Transport within the body and control and regulation are also vital functions.
Incorrect. Levels of organization are important in the study of anatomy and physiology, but are not independently a vital function.
Incorrect. Homeostasis and balance are important, but those terms refer to the result of vital functions, rather than to the functions themselves.
Incorrect. These are organ systems, not independent vital functions.

feedback.p: Correct. Inferior and superior are opposites; so are anterior and posterior.
Incorrect. Inferior and superior are opposites, but medial is the opposite of lateral, not anterior.
Incorrect. Inferior and superior are opposites, but deep is the opposite of superficial, not anterior.
Inferior and superior are opposites, but distal is the opposite of proximal, not anterior.
